title: 106_s3034
content: The Act titled "Home Health Refinement Amendments of 2000" eliminates a 15 percent reduction in payment rates under the Medicare Prospective Payment System for home health services. The Social Security Act is amended to provide for computation of a standard prospective payment amount based on audited cost report data for a 12-month period. The system shall calculate payments based on standardized amounts to account for variations in case mix and wage adjustments among home health agencies, while recognizing regional and urban differences. The amendment will take effect as part of the Medicare, Medicaid enactment. The amendment will take effect as part of the Medicare, Medicaid, and SCHIP Balanced Budget Refinement Act of 1999. SEC. 3. ADDITIONAL PAYMENTS FOR OUTLIERS. Section 1895(b)(5) of the Social Security Act is amended to include temporary additional payments for outliers, authorizing $500,000,000 for each fiscal year from 2001 to 2005. The Secretary shall use a loss-sharing ratio of 90 percent for additional payments under this section, without reducing the standard prospective payment amount. Section 1895(b)(3)(C) of the Act is amended to reflect the changes. SEC. 4. Additional payments under the prospective payment system for services in rural areas and security services. Additional payment amounts are proposed for home health services in rural areas and security services under the Social Security Act. The payment for home health services in rural areas would be increased to 110 percent of the usual amount, while an additional payment for security services is also suggested. The Secretary will provide additional payment for security services to individuals receiving home health services in high-risk areas, as determined by the Secretary. Adjustments for budget neutrality will not apply to these additional payments. The amendments made by this section apply to items and services furnished on or after October 1, 2000. The amendments exclude nonroutine medical supplies from the PPS for home health services, effective October 1, 2000. The amendment excludes nonroutine medical supplies from the prospective payment system for home health services, starting in 2001. Payment will be based on the lesser of the actual charge or the amount determined under the fee schedule. The Secretary will adjust payments to ensure budget neutrality for the exclusion of nonroutine medical supplies from the home health services payment system starting in 2001. Conforming amendments are made to related sections of the Social Security Act. The amendments made by this section apply to items and services furnished on or after October 1, 2000, excluding medical supplies and durable medical equipment. Rule of construction regarding telehomehealth services. Rule of construction regarding telehomehealth services: Section 1895(b) of the Act is amended to allow home health agencies to provide services via telecommunications systems without restrictions. Cost data for these services must be included in the cost report submitted to the Secretary. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will report to Congress within a year on the feasibility of including home health services provided through telecommunications systems. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will report to Congress on the feasibility of including home health services for payment and physician certification requirements under the Social Security Act.
